question: Which country houses the "Lake Bourget"?
explanation: Lake Bourget, also known as Lac du Bourget or Lac Gris (Grey Lake), is a lake located at the southernmost end of the Jura Mountains in France. It is the deepest lake located entirely within France, and either the largest or second-largest after Lac de Grand-Lieu depending on the season. It is a Ramsar Wetland lake.
